title: 12-hour water cut in several areas of Colombo today
byline: A 12-hour water cut will be in effect in several areas of Colombo from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. today (May 25), the National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) has announced.

title: New Zealand’s Deputy PM Winston Peters arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Foreign Affairs of New Zealand Winston Peters has arrived in the island.

title: Heavy showers above 75mm expected in several areas today
byline: Showers will occur at times in the Western, Sabaragamuwa, North-western and Central provinces and in the Galle and Matara districts today (25), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Israeli strike kills nine of Gaza doctor’s children, hospital says
byline: An Israeli air strike on Gaza hit the home of a doctor and killed nine of her 10 children, the hospital where she works in the city of Khan Younis says.

title: Cases of dengue and chikungunya on the rise, Dy Health Minister
byline: The number of cases of dengue and chikungunya in the country are continuing to rise steadily according to current data, Deputy Minister of Health Dr. Hansaka Wijemuni has said.

title: Malini Fonseka’s remains brought to National Film Corporation
byline: The remains of late veteran actress Malini Fonseka, fondly known as the “Queen of Sri Lankan Cinema”, has been brought to the National Film Corporation a short while ago for the public to pay their last respects.

title: Malini Fonseka’s remains to lie in state today for public to pay respect
byline: The remains of late veteran actress Malini Fonseka, known as the “Queen of Sri Lankan Cinema”, is scheduled to be brought to the National Film Corporation of Sri Lanka today (25) for the public to pay their last respects.

title: Tourist arrivals in May top 90,000
byline: A total of 91,785 tourists have arrived in the country thus far in May, data from the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) shows.

title: Russian drones attack Kyiv, other Ukrainian cities, three dead outside the capital
byline: Russian forces attacked Kyiv and other cities early on Sunday, injuring at least 11 people in the capital, killing three people in towns around it and damaging dwellings and other buildings, officials said.

title: SJB electoral organisers continue to resign
byline: A number of electoral organisers of the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) have resigned from their respective positions due to issues relating to the selection of members for local government bodies.

title: Only 40 medicinal drugs in short supply at hospitals - Deputy Minister clarifies
byline: Deputy Minister of Health Dr. Hansaka Wijemuni has issued a clarification following media reports that claimed 180 types of medicines are in short supply at hospitals across the country.

title: Bird Flu: Several countries halt poultry imports from Brazil
byline: India, Albania and Namibia have joined the list of countries imposing a total ban on poultry imports from Brazil, while Angola has opted for a more limited restriction.

title: New Zealand Deputy PM Winston Peters arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Foreign Affairs of New Zealand Winston Peters has arrived in the island on an official visit.

title: 19 killed, 90 injured as hailstorm plays havoc in Pakistan’s Punjab
byline: At least 19 people were killed and over 90 others injured as severe weather, including strong winds and hailstorms, lashed several districts across Pakistan’s eastern Punjab province on Saturday, an official statement said on Sunday.

title: Man who robbed goods worth Rs. 100mn arrested by CCD
byline: An individual has been arrested for the theft of goods worth nearly Rs. 100 million from various parts of the country.

title: Remanded ex-Minister Duminda Dissanayake admitted to prison hospital
byline: Former Minister Duminda Dissanayake, who was arrested and remanded following the discovery of a gold-plated firearm at a prominent apartment complex in Havelock Town on Tuesday (20), has been admitted to the prison hospital.

title: Second-year student at Wayamba National College of Education commits suicide in hostel
byline: A second-year student attached to the Wayamba National College of Education has reportedly committed suicide in her dormitory.

title: Heavy showers above 100mm expected in parts of the island
byline: Heavy showers above 100 mm can be expected at some places in the next 24 hours in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Nuwara-Eliya, Kandy, Galle and Matara districts, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Large crowd gathers to pay last respects to Malini Fonseka
byline: A large crowd continues to arrive at the National Film Corporation on Sunday (25) to pay their final respects to the late veteran actress Malini Fonseka, fondly known as the “Queen of Sri Lankan Cinema.”

title: 7-year-old killed in wild elephant attack in Gomarankadawala
byline: A 7-year-old child has died after being attacked by a wild elephant in the Indikatuwewa area of Gomarankadawala.

title: Supplementary medical professionals warn of trade union action
byline: Joint Council for Professions Supplementary to Medicine (JCPSM) has decided to take trade union action due to the government’s failure to provide solutions to issues within its service.

title: Miss England quits Miss World pageant over ‘harassment’: Telangana minister demands probe
byline: Milla Magee, Miss England 2024, has been making headlines after she quit the Miss World pageant, citing “personal and ethical concerns”, claiming she was harassed in Telangana. The 24-year-old earlier arrived in Hyderabad for the pageant on May 7 but withdrew from the competition and returned to the UK on May 16.

title: Three arrested over shooting Thusitha Halloluwa’s vehicle
byline: Three suspects, including a female, have been arrested over the recent assault and shooting at former Lotteries Board Director Thusitha Halloluwa’s vehicle at Narahenpita.

title: ‘Red’ warning issued over strong winds and rough seas
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued as issued a ‘Red’ warning for the sea areas extending from Chilaw to Kankasanthurai via Puttalam and Mannar and from Matara to Pottuvil via Hambanthota.

title: Gunmen open fire at residence in Panadura
byline: Two persons on a motorcycle have opened fire at a residence located near a garment factory in the Madupitiya area of Pinwatta, Panadura, this evening (25).

title: President Dissanayake pays last respects to Malini Fonseka
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake paid his final respects this evening (25) to the late veteran actress Malini Fonseka, fondly known as the “Queen of Sri Lankan Cinema.”

title: Russia launches war’s largest air attack on Ukraine, kills at least 12 people
byline: Russian forces launched a barrage of 367 drones and missiles at Ukrainian cities overnight, including the capital Kyiv, in the largest aerial attack of the war so far, killing at least 12 people and injuring dozens more, officials said.
